class.name: RegExMatch
class.brief_description: Contains the results of a [RegEx] search.
class.description: Contains the results of a single [RegEx] match returned by [method RegEx.search] and [method RegEx.search_all]. It can be used to find the position and range of the match and its capturing groups, and it can extract its substring for you.

method.name: get_end
method.description: Returns the end position of the match within the source string. The end position of capturing groups can be retrieved by providing its group number as an integer or its string name (if it's a named group). The default value of 0 refers to the whole pattern. Returns -1 if the group did not match or doesn't exist.

method.name: get_group_count
method.description: Returns the number of capturing groups.

method.name: get_start
method.description: Returns the starting position of the match within the source string. The starting position of capturing groups can be retrieved by providing its group number as an integer or its string name (if it's a named group). The default value of 0 refers to the whole pattern. Returns -1 if the group did not match or doesn't exist.

method.name: get_string
method.description: Returns the substring of the match from the source string. Capturing groups can be retrieved by providing its group number as an integer or its string name (if it's a named group). The default value of 0 refers to the whole pattern. Returns an empty string if the group did not match or doesn't exist.

members.member: A dictionary of named groups and its corresponding group number. Only groups that were matched are included. If multiple groups have the same name, that name would refer to the first matching one.
An [Array] of the match and its capturing groups.
The source string used with the search pattern to find this matching result.
